extension.name: Membership Pro K2 items Restriction
extension.author: Tuan Pham Ngoc
extension.license: GNU General Public License version 3, or later
extension.description: This plugin check to see whether users can access to a k2 item. Only publish it if you use Membership Pro K2 Restriction Settings plugin to restrict access for subscribers

field.name: redirect_url
field.label: Redirect URL
field.description: URL of the page users will be redirected to when they are not allowed to access to the k2 item. You should put the url of the subscription plans page on your site into this param

field.name: protection_method
field.label: Protection Method
field.description: Select the method you want to use to protect the article
field.option: Prevent Access to Item K2 Detail Page

field.name: display_k2_items_in_profile
field.label: Display K2 Items In Profile
field.description: If set to Yes, the list of k2 items which subscriber can access to will be displayed in his profile

field.name: allow_search_engine
field.label: Allow Search Engine
field.description: Select to Yes to allow search engine bots to see and index the protected content

field.name: make_new_item_free_for_x_days
field.label: Make New Items Free For X Days
field.description: If enter a number here, K2 items will be free for everyone for the first X days from the time it's published

field.name: release_item_older_than_x_days
field.label: Release K2 Items Older Than X Days
field.description: If enter a number here, K2 items older than this entered number days will be free to access to everyone

field.name: display_empty_categories
field.label: Display Empty Categories
field.description: Set this to Yes if you want to display categories without any items added to it yet.

field.name: restrict_children_categories
field.label: Restrict Children Categories
field.description: Set this to Yes if you restrict access to a category, it's children categories will be restricted, too

field.name: show_on_frontend
field.label: Show On Frontend
field.description: If set to Yes, this plugin will be available on frontend add/edit plan form
